DOC.brief_summary: This investigation seeks to build upon existing evidence that a relationship exists between body mass and timing and the number of erupted teeth.
DOC.brief_title: Correlation Between Somatic Growth and Number of Erupted Deciduous Teeth
DOC.detailed_description: Alteration in the order of teeth eruption denotes a disorder in normal development of the teeth, rather than delayed or accelerated growth. The more time deviation of teeth eruption from normal, the more possible the presence of a problem in development of teeth. For these reasons having a non-invasive tool such as body mass index to determine if development will be slower than average, could be helpful to the practitioner.
DOC.criteria: Healthy infants aged 536 months. 2Absence of medical and congenital diseases. 3Full term infants. 4Residents of Cairo governorate. Presence of natal and neonatal teeth.
